clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Registry Of Magnetic Resonance Imaging in Non-Approved DEvices
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Registry Of Magnetic Resonance Imaging in Non-Approved DEvices

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are providing MRI in patients with non-MRI approved CIED's (Cardiac Implanted Electronic Devices)

primary_outcome.description: Change in lead impedance or sensing

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Thresholds of Pacing Lead

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of change or no change
Measured in heart rate and blood pressure
What sensations, if any, are reported by the patient

primary_outcome.measure: Interference Between the Implanted Cardiac Electronic Device and MRI
primary_outcome.description: Measure any change in device battery voltage

arm_group.description: MRI; Critical Care Monitoring, Device Programming

intervention.intervention_name: Initiate ACLS protocol if lethal arrythmia develops

study_pop.textblock: For all patients in whom a clinical MRI examination is felt to be important in the patients care, and in whom the potential benefits clearly outweigh the risks of an MRI exam as referred from various primary and/or subspecialty physicians.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Anyone with a cardiac device
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anyone who cannot consent for themselves or who don't have a durable power of attorney

overall_official.affiliation: Saint Luke's Hospital of Kansas City

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share the IPD
